turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: 'Cause if it was me, I could just catch a Greyhound back.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Oh, you're not going to kill yourself this time. I wish I'd known...

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: Why can't I go out to your folks' house? Give me one good reason.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I have to see how things are first. My father's sick, you understand? They wouldn't be prepared for me bringing anyone.

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: So how long am I supposed to sit an' twiddle my thumbs in this place?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: If you can't do what I ask, Ray, use that money to go back home, then.

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: Bobby, don't talk like that...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Okay, Ray...

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: Or maybe sit out by the pool an' get myself nice an' tan for you. Would you like that?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Sure...

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: It brings out my eyes...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Bye, honey, I'll call you in a couple of days.

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: Okay...

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: This certainly is an improvement on the motel an' the coffee shop.  How could you have left such a beautiful place, Bobby?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Rayette.

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Just finish eating.

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: Oh, am I holdin' up dessert?

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: It's all right. He don't mean anything by that.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I don't, huh?

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: Bobby...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I can't talk to you right now, leave me alone...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Come on.

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: Wait a sec. I want Tita to take a picture of you an' me in front of the place...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: No, let's go...

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: I'm gonna go in that cafe an' get some coffee. You want anything?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: You got any change?

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: Sure you don't want anything?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Fill it up.

turns.speaker: PALM
turns.text: Look at my car! Piece of shit! I just bought it brand new from a used-car lot, and the steering goes to the pot on me!

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You're lucky no one was hurt.

turns.speaker: PALM
turns.text: Seven hundred dollars, down the toilet! I'd like to go back and punch the son of a bitch out! Can you give us a lift?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What's your name?

turns.speaker: PALM
turns.text: Palm Apodaca.

turns.speaker: PALM
turns.text: How far are you going to?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Washington.

turns.speaker: PALM
turns.text: We'll get off in Washington and hook another ride.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: PALM
turns.text: Alaska.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Alaska? Are you on vacation?

turns.speaker: PALM
turns.text: You don't have to tell everybody about it. Pretty soon they'll all go there and it won't be so clean.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: How do you know it's clean?

turns.speaker: PALM
turns.text: I saw a picture of it. Alaska is very clean. It appeared to look very white to me... Don't you think?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yeah. That's before the big thaw.

turns.speaker: PALM
turns.text: I had to leave this place. I got depressed, seeing all the crap. And the thing is, they're making more crap, you know? They've got so many stores and stuff and junk full of crap, I can't believe it.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: PALM
turns.text: Who? People, that's who! Pretty soon there won't be room for anyone. They're selling more crap that people go and buy than you can imagine. Oofh! Crap! I believe everybody should have a big hole where they throw in all this stuff and burn it.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Well...

turns.speaker: PALM
turns.text: It's just filthy. People are dirty. I think that's the biggest thing that's wrong with people. I think they wouldn't be as violent if they were clean, because then they wouldn't have anybody to pick on... Oofh... Dirt...

turns.speaker: PALM
turns.text: Hey, mack!

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Shut up.  You have bread, don't you, and a toaster of some kind?

turns.speaker: PALM
turns.text: Fantastic! That you could figure all that out, and lay that down on her, to come up with a way you could get your toast.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I didn't get it, did I?

turns.speaker: PALM
turns.text: No, but it was very clever... I would of just punched her out.

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: Can I get you anything else?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: No. How much do I owe you?

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: Five'll do it.

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: No substitutions.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What does that mean? You don't have any tomatoes?

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: No. We have tomatoes.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: But I can't have any. Is that what you mean?

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: Only what's on the menu...  A Number Two: Plain omelette. It comes with cottage fries and rolls.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I know what it comes with, but that's not what I want.

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: I'll come back when you've made up your mind...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Wait, I've made up my mind. I want a plain omelette, forget the tomatoes, don't put potatoes on the plate, and give me a side of wheat toast and a cup of coffee.

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: I'm sorry, we don't have side orders of toast. I can give you an English muffin or a coffee roll.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What do you mean, you don't have side orders of toast? You make sandwiches, don't you?

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: Would you like to talk to the manager?

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: I don't make the rules.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Okay, I'll make it as easy for you as I can. Give me an omelette, plain, and a chicken salad sandwich on wheat toast -- no butter, no mayonnaise, no lettuce -- and a cup of coffee.

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: One Number Two, and a chicken sal san -- hold the butter, the mayo, the lettuce -- and a cup of coffee... Anything else?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Now all you have to do is hold the chicken, bring me the toast, charge me for the sandwich, and you haven't broken any rules.

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: You want me to hold the chicken.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yeah. I want you to hold it between your knees.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Wasn't it, ladies?

turns.speaker: TWINKY
turns.text: Are you talking to us?

turns.speaker: TWINKY
turns.text: We been wantin' to ask you something. Are you the guy on YV?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Am I on TV?

turns.speaker: TWINKY
turns.text: She says you're the one that sells all the cars on TV.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Well, I don't claim to have sold 'em all. They still have some left, I believe.

turns.speaker: TWINKY
turns.text: I'm gonna give you our number, Donnie, just in case...  We're both professionals, if you didn't guess.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Well, you seem very professional...

turns.speaker: TWINKY
turns.text: I always tell everyone the same thing. I got rolled and beat up real bad recently, and since then it's two for one, an' I work strictly in tandem with Betty...

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: Tea.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Would you tell her Bobby's here?

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: Oh my goodness... Bobby...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Hi, Tita.

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: Robert Eroica...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Now don't...

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: No, I'm not...  I'm not.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: That's good.

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: I just can't look at you.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Don't, then.

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: You always do this to me.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Well, I don't mean to.  Here's your tea, Tita.

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: Thank you...  Oh no, don't put it on there...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: This is a very special, very old CB 275...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: You know who it once belonged to?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: Waldnit von Schnechter. Prewar.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: No kidding.

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: Robert...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Very nice.

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: I have to talk seriously with you...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Everybody still up on the Island?

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: Well, Herbert's mostly on the mainland because of the orchestra, so at the moment, there's just Daddy, Carl and myself... and Van Oost.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Who's Van Oost?

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: Catherine -- she's a pianist. She's working with Carl.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Carl's a fiddler. What's he doing coaching piano?

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: Well, 11 months ago he was on his bicycle, on his way to the post office in La Roche... and he ran into a Jeep and sprained his neck...

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: It's not funny. He permanently sprained his neck, and since then it's been extremely difficult for him to tuck the violin.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Crashes into a Jeep and totals his neck.  That's Carl...

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: Robert, I have to tell you something...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: Daddy's very ill.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Oh, well, what, what's he...

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: He's had two strokes.

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: He's not... They feel he... maybe he might not recover, and that he'll either...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Don't tell me about this...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yeah... I guess so...

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: I'm going back up tonight. Will you go with me?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: No...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I'd rather drive up myself and... maybe go into Canada after... And I can't stay long, Tita, probably a week, at the most.

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Well...  I better let you...

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: Wait...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Maybe you better stay, then.

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: No, I need to talk to you, about so many things...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Well, I'll be seeing you in a couple of days, won't I?

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: Oh God, I'm so glad, Robert, that you're coming...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yeah, me, too...

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: It'll be so good for you, and for Daddy, because you know, you've never really...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Tita, I've got to go...

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: All right...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Well, I really appreciate it, Carl.

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: I don't think you should infer Daddy was wrong in front of him...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: How long have you been staying here?

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: A couple of months.

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: He has ways of communicating, Robert. I can tell when he's expressing approval or disapproval, just from his eyes...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Uhm hmm. Some range.

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: It's not that bad.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yes, it is. I can't take seeing him, sitting there like a stone.

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: A week or two isn't going to ruin your life, for Godsakes.

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: I mean, you think I'm that happy?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: No, I don't.  You should've left a long time ago.

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: We can't all get up and leave, can we? I mean, there are certain needs you have to respond to...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What questions?

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: Well, do you -- I mean, have you enjoyed all these... strange things you've been doing?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Sometimes.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Why? Am I some kind of freak to you or something?

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: No, no, I don't think that, I'm just curious about it...  Do you think I'm a freak?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Sort of.

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: Oh no... Why? What is it? The way I look?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: No, I don't really think you're a freak.

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: I probably am, but I don't care. I mean, I wasn't that blessed to begin with, and when would I have had time to make any improvements...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What about Carl and Catherine? Is he just coaching her, or what?

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: Constantly. Night and day. And unless I get up before the birds, I can't get in any practice time for myself...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Uhm hmm.

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: Actually, it's very admirable, the way she works. She'll probably be enormously successful, because she's attractive as well, not that that's so important in music, but...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You're attractive, Tita. If you just did a little more with yourself...

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: Like what?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Well, if you just maybe did something with your hair, or...

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: Oh, let's not talk about my hair, it does what it wants to, and anyway, who cares, I want to talk about you...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: There's nothing to say, Tita...

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: Well, you're not going to run out on me right away, are you?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: Do you want some gingerbread?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: With applesauce?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: No, thanks...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Look at that.

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: Why are you being so mean?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I'm not. He does walk funny. Don't you see that?

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: I don't think I'd notice. I'm so used to Carl.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yeah, well, he's...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I think he's got a terrific personality.

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: You know, he was formerly a sailor.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Look, can't you see that, what I'm talking about?

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: Sailors are sadistic, I feel.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Where is she, anyway?

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: My turn.

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: It's none of your business!

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Where's Catherine?!

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: I don't know where she is!

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I'm talking to you, Tita!

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: Can't I have anything to myself, dammit?!

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: You're leaving?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yeah. I said a week, and I've overstayed myself...

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: You were going without saying goodbye?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I didn't want to say goodbye to anyone.

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: But what about me?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I'll say goodbye to you, Tita.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Bye, now.

turns.speaker: TITA
turns.text: Bye, Robert.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: What have you been doing since then?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What have I been doing? Different things, different jobs, here and there. Nothing that interesting.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: And you no longer play at all?

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Hello...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I guess you fell in the water.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Yes, intentionally.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: That's dangerous, you know.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Swimming?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Playing piano all day and then jumping into cold water. You could get a cramp.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: I love to swim, and I don't mind the cold at all. It's invigorating.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Well, I wouldn't want to get too invigorated myself.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What would I do with it? Run amok?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Besides piano and swimming, what else do you do?

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Well, there's fishing and boating. There's concerts on the mainland and... but I feel silly telling you. This is really your home. You probably know better than I what there is to do.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Nothing? Then it must be very boring for you here.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: That's right. Have you anything to suggest?

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: I don't know. Let me give it some thought.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Right now I'm going to run a hot tub and soak myself.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Then after that?

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: After that, I plan to read some music and rest for awhile.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Tomorrow, then.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Tomorrow's a full practice day...  But the day after is kind of open.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Carl has hydrotherapy on Tuesdays.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: The day after tomorrow.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: If you're free.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yeah, I'll probably be free.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: One thing that's hard to understand is how you could have this incredible background in music, and then just walk away from it, without a second thought...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I gave it a second thought.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: I mean, how could you not play anymore? That's so strange to me...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I have played a few times. Here and there. As a matter of fact, I was once a rehearsal pianist for a Las Vegas musical revue.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: You don't call that music, though.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Of course I do. It's music. You know...

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: That was beautiful, Robert. I'm surprised...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: I was really very moved by the way you...

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Is that funny?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: It wasn't supposed to be, it just struck me that way.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Nothing. It's just that... I picked the easiest piece I could remember. I think I first played it when I was 8 years old and I played it better then.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: It doesn't matter. It was the feeling I was affected by.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I didn't have any.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: You had no inner feeling?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: None.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Then I must have been supplying it.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Wait...

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Well, at least you're accomplished at something...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: At being a fake.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Catherine...

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: No, you're very good at it. I'm really impressed.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You think I'm a fake.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: I think it's what you think.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: No, it isn't what I think.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Look... You made a very calculated move, and then made me feel embarrassed for responding to you. That wasn't necessary.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yes, it was. You've made it clear that if I can cut a little piano, I might get a little response.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: I don't think that's accurate...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Up to now, what I've been getting from you are meaningful looks over the dinner table and a lot of vague suggestions about the day after tomorrow...

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: I'm not conscious of having given you any meaningful looks. And as for the day after tomorrow, this is the day after tomorrow, and I am, unfortunately, seeing you... Now if you'll excuse me, I'd like to take a bath.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: It's convenient to fake looking for something right now, isn't it?

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: I'm not faking anything. I'm looking for some bath oil...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Some bath oil?

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: I don't find your language that charming.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: It's direct, anyway, which seems to be difficult for you.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: I'd like you to leave now. Is that direct enough?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Serious, that's what's important to you?

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Yes, that's what's important to me...

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: No, don't do that...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Shut up...

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: No inner feeling.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: I don't believe vou.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: I married him when I was 17. He was a cellist, and I thought he was the most brilliant man I'd ever met... And I'm sure he was, because at that age, I hadn't met that many... But he was insidious, you know. He had me convinced that I was a mediocrity, musically, as a woman, as an intellect. But in this completely imperceptible, pleasant way, so that you weren't even sure he was doing it. Anyway, I just woke up one morning and I said, you know something Joseph, you're full of beans, and I left him...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: That's what you said?

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Something witty and devastating like that.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: As a matter of fact, he's the one who introduced me to Carl...  How are you?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I'm fine.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Carl restored my confidence. He really did. He's much more substantial than you give him credit for.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Is he?

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Do you think you could discreetly move across the hall now?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yeah, I think I could.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Robert?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: I could spend some time with you tomorrow morning, before Carl comes back, I mean, if you'd like to.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Of course I'd like to.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: I'm going to pick up some friends of Carl's. Are you all right?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I have to talk to you.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: I'll be back later...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: No, I want to talk to you now. I have to explain something about...

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: No, you don't have to, it isn't necessary...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yes, it is!

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: No, I can't...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Will you let me talk to you, please?

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: I can't do that. I haven't been being fair to Carl. I have to tell you that.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Oh. You have to tell me that.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: What?! I can't hear you!

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: I'm sorry everything's been so confusing, but I have to go, Robert...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Catherine...

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Please, I'll see you later this evening.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: No. It's useless, Robert. It wouldn't work, not ever...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Just give me a chance, will you?

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: I'm trying to be delicate with you, but you're not understanding me. It's not just because of Carl, or my music, but because of you...  I mean, what would it come to? If a person has no love for himself, no respect, no love for his work, his family, his friends, something... How can he ask for love in return? I mean, why should he ask for it?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: And living out here, in this rest home asylum, that's what you want?

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: That'll make you happy.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: I hope it will, yes.  I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Four or five years.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: No, the last time was three years ago.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Did you hear about my misfortune, Robert?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: It's still nearly impossible for me to turn my neck. If I wanted to turn toward Catherine, for instance, I'd first have to twist the whole base of my body around...  ... like this...

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: She's tremendously gifted, this girl.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Is she?

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: I hope you feel at home, Robert.  I'm really glad you're here.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Thanks, Carl...

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Robert, do you mind?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Nothing. Will you excuse us for a while?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You sure you should be playing, Carl?

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: What do you mean? Aside from my neck, I'm in superb shape.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: I'm not aware of it. Like what?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Your serve. Two -- Eighteen.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: I've walked across a stage a number of times, without exciting any particular response...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: That's what I mean...

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: See? There's nothing wrong with the way I walk. Now where are we?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: At game, Carl.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: That's three games to none, Carl.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: All right, let's have a rematch.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I thought you had to go to the mainland today. Aren't you going to miss the ferry?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Oh, for chrissakes...

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Robert, let's not be rude, okay?
